com.jpaulmorrison.graphics

Class BabelParser2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jpaulmorrison.graphics.BabelParser2

  • public class BabelParser2
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is based on a (language) parsing technique called Babel, that I learned in England many years ago! This class definitely has an internal state, so all users must create an instance of it. This class is almost the same as the original JavaFBP BabelParser class, except that it simply returns false when requested to get more data...

      java.lang.String getOutStr()
      Take output generated by syntax scan, and return as String Output index is then set back to zero.
      boolean tb(char mod)
      Test for blank, CR or tab, but with modification (must be 'i', 'n' or 'o') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification) (the only blank tests in DiagramBuilder logic are all mod'd)
      boolean tc(char x)
      This macro compares against a given character.
      boolean tc(char x, char mod)
      Same as tc(char), but with modification (must be 'i', 'n' or 'o') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
      boolean tf()
      This macro compares against a number (figure).
      boolean tf(char mod)
      Same as tf(), but with modification (must be 'i', 'o' or 'n') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
      boolean tl()
      This macro compares against a letter.
      boolean tl(char mod)
      Same as tl(), but with modification (must be 'i', 'o' or 'n') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
      boolean tu()
      Babel 'universal comparator' - it is always true, unless we are at end of file
      boolean tu(char mod)
      Same as tu(), but with modification (must be 'i', 'o' or 'n') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
      boolean w(char x)
      Write one char out to output stream

      • getOutStr

        public java.lang.String getOutStr()
        Take output generated by syntax scan, and return as String Output index is then set back to zero.
        Returns:
        java.lang.String

      • tc

        public boolean tc(char x)
        This macro compares against a given character. Scanning is continuous from the end of one incoming packet to the start of the next one. End of input results in a false result - i.e. end of input is considered to not match _any_ test character.

      • tc

        public boolean tc(char x,
                  char mod)
        Same as tc(char), but with modification (must be 'i', 'n' or 'o') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
        Parameters:
        x - char
        mod - char

      • tb

        public boolean tb(char mod)
        Test for blank, CR or tab, but with modification (must be 'i', 'n' or 'o') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification) (the only blank tests in DiagramBuilder logic are all mod'd)
        Parameters:
        mod - char

      • tf

        public boolean tf()
        This macro compares against a number (figure). Scanning is continuous from the end of one incoming packet to the start of the next one. End of input results in a false result.

      • tf

        public boolean tf(char mod)
        Same as tf(), but with modification (must be 'i', 'o' or 'n') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
        Parameters:
        mod - char

      • tl

        public boolean tl()
        This macro compares against a letter. Scanning is continuous from the end of one incoming packet to the start of the next one. End of input results in a false result.

      • tl

        public boolean tl(char mod)
        Same as tl(), but with modification (must be 'i', 'o' or 'n') ('n' is equivalent to old Babel 'IO' - I- and O-modification)
        Parameters:
        mod - char

      • tu

        public boolean tu()
        Babel 'universal comparator' - it is always true, unless we are at end of file
